The Instrumentation Engineer works in a small integrated team of engineers and technicians which support the Polysonic Wind Tunnel (PSWT) located in Berkeley, MO. The Polysonic Wind Tunnel is a blowdown wind tunnel with a test section size of 4ft x 4ft and has a Mach number range of 0.45 to 5.3.

A wide variety of hardware is used in the wind tunnel, and most systems are Windows based PCs with National Instruments front ends along with many Siemens and Allen Bradley Programmable logic controllers (PLCs). The control systems are generally LabVIEW based or ladder logic software. Other programming languages used are C++, Matlab and WonderWare Intouch.

The Infrastructure Platform Engineering (IPE) team, part of Infrastructure and Cloud division, is responsible for the engineering and operation of LSEG's Group Engineering's core infrastructure services, including data centers, storage, private cloud, platforms, databases, and middleware. As a delivery manager , you will drive delivery optimisation across a range of large-scale strategic and tactical initiatives, helping IPE to meet its objectives, while delivering greater value to its customers and partners. You will act as a strategic liaison between IPE, broader programmes and our business partners- driving better alignment on business priorities and value-driven prioritisation of our Book of Work. You will create delivery structures and governance which enable IPE to better anticipate and respond across demand requirements, while transitioning from project-by-project thinking to continuous value delivery. You will develop needed reporting and insights required to visualise, control and assure the success of the delivery pipeline in IPE, thereby delivering measurable value through enhanced agility, visibility, and customer alignment.
